question1: What types of solar panels are supported?
answer1: The application supports crystalline silicon solar panels, including monocrystalline and polycrystalline, which are the most common in production.
question2: What should I do if I forgot my password?
answer2: • On the login screen, click the 'Forgot Password?' button. • Follow the instructions and enter your email. • The system will guide you through the password recovery process, after which you will be redirected back to the login screen.
question3: How do I change my account information?
answer3: • Log in with owner privileges and go to the profile screen. • Click the 'Edit Information' button to open the editing screen. • Update the information and save the changes.
question4: How do I log out of my account?
answer4: • Go to the settings screen. • Click the 'Log Out' button. • The system will end your session and redirect you to the login screen.
question5: How do I add a camera for monitoring?
answer5: • Log in with owner, administrator, or moderator rights and go to the main device management screen. • Click the 'Add Camera' button. • Fill out the form with the camera details. • Confirm the addition, and the camera will appear in the list of available devices.
question6: How do I clear the trash bin of deleted cameras or records?
answer6: Manual cleaning: • Log in with owner, administrator, or moderator rights and go to the trash bin screen. • Click the 'Clear' button and select the interval for deleting records. • Confirm the action, and the records will be deleted from the database. The event will be logged. Automatic cleaning: • Make sure the 'Automatic Trash Cleaning' toggle is enabled. • The system automatically deletes records older than 30 days, logging the event.
question7: How do I change my subscription level?
answer7: • Log in with owner rights. • On the profile screen, select the subscription change option. • The system will display available plans. • Choose a new plan, confirm the changes, and update payment details if necessary.
question8: How can an administrator change AI parameters?
answer8: • Log in with administrator rights. • Go to the admin panel. • Change the AI sensitivity parameters to defects. • The system will apply the changes and log them.
question9: How does the solar panel quality check work?
answer9: • Send a panel image (in JPEG or PNG format, in the electroluminescent spectrum) via an HTTP request to the /inspection API endpoint. The system analyzes the image using AI: • If no defects are detected, the result is saved to the database. • If defects are found, the system classifies them and stores the image and description in the database.
question10: What are the image requirements for analysis?
answer10: • Format: JPEG or PNG. • Resolution: from 200x200 up to 1920x1080 pixels (Full HD). • Quality: clear images without blurring, noise, glare, or sharp lighting transitions. • Type of shot: electroluminescent spectrum. • The camera must be stationary, and shots taken at the same angle.
question11: What defects can the application detect?
answer11: The system is trained to detect: • Microcracks in the panel structure. • Violations in the structure of individual elements. • Contamination and foreign inclusions.
question12: What is the image processing speed?
answer12: • The system processes one panel in 20-30 seconds. • Performance: at least 2 panels per minute (for 60-cell panels), with peak loads up to 5 panels per minute.
question13: What should I do if I can't find an answer in the FAQ?
answer13: If the answer is not available, support contact details will be displayed on the FAQ screen. Contact support for further assistance.
